title: Welcome
text:
Hi, I’m Jocely Lopez Luna, a researcher with a Bachelor of Arts in environmental science (Columbia University ’20) and 5 years of work experience in seismology at Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory. I’ve worked extensively with seismic data, programming, and quantitative research, and I’m currently expanding my expertise through an MS in Statistics at Baruch College.
At Lamont, I work on modernizing analog seismic data and modeling atmospheric and underground nuclear explosions. My research has been published in the Bulletin of the Seismological Society of America.
As a Catholic, my faith guides my approach to learning, discovery, and service. I strive to bring Truth, integrity, and purpose to everything I do.
Here’s my resume. Explore my work, and let’s connect!
